intro: Resnova nossibeensis, commonly known as the Nossibe Resnova, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
